title: FizzBuzz
description:
Implement the classic FizzBuzz programming challenge.

## Requirements

1. Create a function called `fizzBuzz` that takes a number
2. Return:
   - "FizzBuzz" if the number is divisible by both 3 and 15
   - "Fizz" if divisible by 3 only
   - "Buzz" if divisible by 5 only
   - The number itself (as a string) otherwise

3. Create a function `fizzBuzzRange` that takes a number n and returns an array of FizzBuzz results from 1 to n

## Expected Output

- fizzBuzz(15) returns "FizzBuzz"
- fizzBuzz(9) returns "Fizz"
- fizzBuzz(10) returns "Buzz"
- fizzBuzz(7) returns "7"
- fizzBuzzRange(5) returns ["1", "2", "Fizz", "4", "Buzz"]
hints: Check for divisibility by both 3 AND 5 first (use && operator)
Use the modulo operator (%) to check divisibility: n % 3 === 0
Order matters: check the most specific condition first
For fizzBuzzRange, use a loop and push results to an array
Remember to return the number as a string using String(n) or n.toString()
